TradingPartnerId.description: Unique internal identifier defined by SPS Commerce which identifies the relationship

ShipmentIdentification.description: Identification number assigned to the shipment by the shipper that uniquely identifies the shipment from origin to ultimate destination and is not subject to modification

ShipDate.description: Date shipment will leave the ship from location

ShipmentTime.description: Time the shipment left the ship from location. [All standard XML formats are accepted.]

TsetPurposeCode.description: Code identifying purpose or function of the transmission

ShipNoticeTime.description: Time the document was created. [All standard XML formats are accepted]

ASNStructureCode.description: Code is the reflection of the structure of the document

ExchangeRate.description: The rate to be applied to convert one currency to another

BillOfLadingNumber.description: A shipper assigned number that outlines the ownership, terms of carriage and is a receipt of goods

CarrierProNumber.description: Reference number assigned by the carrier

AppointmentNumber.description: Number assigned by the buying or logistics organization approving the delivery, routing, or pickup of the shipment. This is not the tracking number

DocumentVersion.description: Used to communicate the version number of the current document

DocumentRevision.description: Used to communicate the revision number of the current document

DateTimeQualifier.description: Code specifying the type of date

Time.description: All standard XML formats are accepted.

examples: New products only. Do not reuse packaging

PackingMaterial.description: Code identifying the type of packaging material

LadingQuantity.description: Number of units/pieces of the lading commodity

WeightQualifier.description: Code defining the type of weight

SpecialHandlingCode.description: Code specifying special transportation handling instructions

examples: New products only. Do not reuse packaging

YesOrNoResponse.description: Code indicating a Yes or No condition or response

AllowChrgIndicator.description: Code which indicates an allowance or charge for the service specified

AllowChrgCode.description: Code describing the type of allowance or charge for the service specified

AllowChrgAgencyCode.description: Code identifying the agency assigning the code values

AllowChrgAgency.description: Agency maintained code identifying the service, promotion, allowance, or charge

AllowChrgAmt.description: Amount of the allowance or charge

AllowChrgPercentQual.description: Code indicating on what basis an allowance or charge percent is calculated

AllowChrgPercent.description: Percentage of allowance or charge. Percentages should be represented as real numbers[0% through 100% should be normalized to 0.0 through 100.00]

PercentDollarBasis.description: Monetary amount that is used when calculating a tax, allowance, or charge amount.

AllowChrgRate.description: Value expressed in monetary currency that applies to the given quantity [i.e. The rate is $5.00 off one dozen]. [AllowChrgRate, AllowChrgQty, AllowChrgQtyUOM fields should all be sent in conjunction with each other]

AllowChrgQtyUOM.description: The unit of measure used in relation with AllowChrgQty[AllowChrgRate, AllowChrgQty, AllowChrgQtyUOM fields should all be sent in conjunction with each other]

AllowChrgQty.description: Numeric value of quantity to which the allowance or charge applies[AllowChrgRate, AllowChrgQty, AllowChrgQtyUOM fields should all be sent in conjunction with each other]

AllowChrgHandlingCode.description: Code indicating method of handling for an allowance or charge

AllowChrgHandlingDescription.description: Free-form textual description of the allowance or charge
examples: This will cover the cost of shipping

LanguageCode.description: Code designating the language used in text. ISO 639 language code

CalculationSequence.description: Used to indicate at what point a value should be used in calculations where orders of operations matter [i.e. 1 would indicate that the related value should be taken first].

TransportationTerms.description: Code that defines to the recipient what types of fees are associated with the movement of goods. By default, if you do not send the TransportationTermsType, you are using the standard codes from the Incoterms website [http://www.iccwbo.org/products-and-services/trade-facilitation/]

RiskOfLossCode.description: Code specifying which party should bear the burden for risk of damage occurring to goods after the sale but before delivery

items.description: Indicates that the related item[s] are following the specified government or industry rules regarding material, manufacturing process and or end product

RegulatoryComplianceQual.description: Code indicating the act or legislation

YesOrNoResponse.description: Code indicating a Yes or No condition or response

RegulatoryComplianceID.description: The ID relating to the RegulatoryComplianceQual, if applicable

RegulatoryAgency.description: Used to indicate the organization responsible for validating or enforcing the RegulatoryComplianceQual when not otherwise specified by the RegulatoryComplianceQual

Description.description: Free-form textual description to clarify the related data elements and their content
examples: New products only. Do not reuse packaging
